intro: Aceratium ferrugineum, commonly known as the rusty acanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves with a reddish-brown underside and its spikes of showy, tubular flowers that range from red to orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
